-ThresholdInterval.set_if: var str = macro("$IcingaCheckPerfCounter_String_ThresholdInterval$"); if (len(str) == 0) { return false; }; return true;

-C.value: try { Use-Icinga -Minimal; } catch { Write-Output 'The Icinga PowerShell Framework is either not installed on the system or not configured properly. Please check https://icinga.com/docs/windows for further details'; Write-Output 'Error:' $$($$_.Exception.Message)Components:`r`n$$( Get-Module -ListAvailable 'icinga-powershell-*' )`r`n'Module-Path:'`r`n$$($$Env:PSModulePath); exit 3; }; Exit-IcingaExecutePlugin -Command 'Invoke-IcingaCheckPerfCounter'

7.description: Used to specify a Critical threshold.
7.caption: Critical

9.description:
An [array] of strings to filter for, excluding the provided counters. Allows
wildcard "*" usage
9.caption: ExcludeCounter

10.description:
Overrides the default behaviour of the plugin in case no check element was found and
prevent the plugin from exiting UNKNOWN and returns OK instead
10.caption: IgnoreEmptyChecks

12.description:
Changes the behavior of the plugin output which check states are printed:
0 (default): Only service checks/packages with state not OK will be printed
1: Only services with not OK will be printed including OK checks of affected check packages including Package config
2: Everything will be printed regardless of the check state
3: Identical to Verbose 2, but prints in addition the check package configuration e.g (All must be [OK])
12.caption: Verbosity

11.description: Set this argument to not write any performance data
11.caption: NoPerfData

2.description: Defines with which Execution Policy the PowerShell is started
2.caption: PowerShell Execution Policy

4.description: Change the value your defined threshold checks against from the current value to a collected time threshold of the Icinga for Windows daemon, as described here: https://icinga.com/docs/icinga-for-windows/latest/doc/service/10-Register-Service-Checks/ An example for this argument would be 1m or 15m which will use the average of 1m or 15m for monitoring.
4.caption: ThresholdInterval

6.description: Used to specify a Warning threshold.
6.caption: Warning

5.description: Used to specify an array of performance counter to check against.
5.caption: PerfCounter

8.description:
An [array] of strings to filter for, only including the provided counters. Allows
wildcard "*" usage
8.caption: IncludeCounter
